key_events.description: Vale's Q4 2025 iron ore production reached 90.4 million tons, a 6% increase year-on-year. Copper production totaled 108.1kt, a 6.2% year-on-year increase. Nickel production reached 46.2kt, a 1.5% year-on-year increase.
Vale revised its total capex estimate for the year from US$5.9 billion to a range between US$5.4 billion and US$5.7 billion.

key_events.event_name: Free Cash Flow Yield Sensitivities Update
key_events.description: Vale updated its free cash flow yield sensitivities for 2026, ranging from 6% to 14% in real terms, assuming an average annual iron ore price (62% Fe) between US$95/t and US$110/t, nickel (LME) between US$15,000/t and US$17,000/t, and copper (LME) between US$9,500/t and US$11,500/t.
Two houses estimate a valuation of more than 10% by the end of 2026, with a target price for Vale's ADR in New York at US$ 15.50 (Santander) and the paper in Brazil at R$ 83 (Ágora).
BTG Pactual highlights the increase of over 25% in the price of nickel in one month, from US$14,000/t to over US$18,000/t.

risk_factors: Potential legal liabilities related to Mariana and Brumadinho
Fluctuations in nickel and copper prices

investment_thesis.bull_case: Vale's strong Q4 2025 production results, particularly in iron ore and copper, coupled with revised capex estimates and positive analyst outlooks, suggest continued growth and profitability. The company's focus on operational efficiency and expansion of copper projects in Carajás further supports a bullish outlook.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Despite positive production results, Vale faces risks related to iron ore price volatility and potential legal liabilities. Some analysts suggest limited room for new highs after a significant appreciation in share price, indicating a potentially reduced investor return margin.

summary_markdown: Vale (VALE3) reported strong Q4 2025 production, with iron ore output at 90.4 million tons, up 6% year-on-year. Copper production reached 108.1kt, a 6.2% increase, and nickel production was 46.2kt, up 1.5%. Full year 2025 iron ore production reached 336.1 million tons, a 2.6% increase over 2024. The company revised its capex estimate from US$5.9 billion to between US$5.4 billion and US$5.7 billion. Vale updated its free cash flow yield sensitivities for 2026, projecting 6% to 14% yields based on iron ore prices between US$95/t and US$110/t. BofA projects Vale's iron ore division to represent approximately 20% of the global seaborne export market. Vale aims to double its copper production to 700,000 tons by 2035. BTG Pactual highlights a 25% increase in nickel prices in one month, reaching over US$18,000/t. Two houses estimate a valuation of more than 10% by the end of 2026, with a target price for Vale's ADR in New York at US$ 15.50 (Santander) and the paper in Brazil at R$ 83 (Ágora). Vale's stock has advanced 17.5% in 2026 on the B3 and accumulates gains of 48% in the last six months. The Capanema project (MG) should reach full capacity in Q2 2026.
